arm_group.description: selection of antibiotic according to medication history
selection of antibiotics according to genotypic resistance

brief_summary.textblock:
We aimed to compare the efficacy of genotypic resistance guided sequential therapy vs.
      empiric therapy in the third line therapy. Factors affecting the eradication rates,
      including the antibiotic resistance, CYP2C19 polymorphism, CagA and VacA status will also be
      assessed.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genotypic Resistance Guided Therapy in Helicobacter Pylori Eradication

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of this study is to compare the regimens selected using either one of the
      method (1) genotypic resistance guided versus (2) medication history guided therapy. (rather
      than to compare the efficacy of any drugs).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients aged greater than 20 years who have persistent H. pylori infection after at
             least two treatments and are willing to receive third line rescue regimens are
             considered eligible for enrollment.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients will be excluded from the study if any one of the following criteria is
             present: (1) children and teenagers aged less than 20 years, (2) history of
             gastrectomy, (3)gastric malignancy, including adenocarcinoma and lymphoma, (4)
             previous allergic reaction to antibiotics (Amoxicillin, Klaricid, Cravit) and prompt
             pump inhibitors (esomeprazole), (5)contraindication to treatment drugs, (6) pregnant
             or lactating women, (7) severe concurrent disease.

intervention.description:
Nexium  (esomeprazole), 40mg, bid, 14 days, plus
Amoxicillin (Amoxicillin Trihydrate), 1gm, bid, 7 days, plus
Flagyl (metronidazole), 500mg, bid, 7 days, plus either one of the following drugs
Select either one of the drugs according to medication history Cravit (levofloxacin) , 250 mg, bid, D8-14 Klaricid (clarithromycin), 500 mg, bid , D8-14 Tetracycline, 500 mg, bid, D8-14
intervention.other_name: selection of antibiotics according to medication history

intervention.description:
Nexium  (esomeprazole), 40mg, bid, 14 days, plus
Amoxicillin (Amoxicillin Trihydrate), 1gm, bid, 7 days, plus
Flagyl (metronidazole), 500mg, bid, 7 days, plus either one of the following drugs
Select either one of the drugs according to genotypic resistance results Cravit (levofloxacin) , 250 mg, bid, D8-14 Klaricid (clarithromycin), 500 mg, bid , D8-14 Tetracycline, 500 mg, bid, D8-14
intervention.other_name: selection of antibiotic according to genotypic resistance

facility.name: National Taiwan University Hospital, Yun-Lin Branch

clinical_study.official_title: Genotypic Resistance Guided Therapy in the Treatment of Helicobacter Pylori Infection

primary_outcome.description:
Primary End Point: Eradication rate will be evaluated according to Intent-to-treat (ITT) and per-protocol (PP) analyses.
(genotypic resistance versus empirical therapy) Urea breath test will be used to determine the eradication status
primary_outcome.measure: Eradication rate after third line rescue therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: eradication rate in subgroup analysis according to antibiotic resistance and treatment regimen
secondary_outcome.measure: eradication rates in subgroup analysis by antibiotic resistance and regimen

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
